alert.note: Alert for San Miguel (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 08 at 7:12PM MDT until July 08 at 11:30PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... The Hermits Peak Calf Canyon Burn Scar in... Western San Miguel County in northeastern New Mexico... * Until 1130 PM MDT. * At 712 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated slow-moving thunderstorms producing heavy rain over Mineral Hill, San Geronimo, and Tecolote Creek within the Hermits Peak Calf Canyon Burn Scar. Up to 1.3 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 1 inch in 30 minutes. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Excessive rainfall over the burn scar will impact the Tecolote Creek drainage area including Cabo Lucero Creek, Canon Mesteno, Ojitos Frios Creek and Tecolote Creek. The debris flow can consist of rock, mud, vegetation and other loose materials. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding in and around the Hermits Peak Calf Canyon Burn Scar. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the Hermits Peak Calf Canyon Burn Scar. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... San Geronimo, San Pablo, Mineral Hill and Ojitos Frios. This includes the following highways... State Road 283 between Mile Markers 6 and 12...and near Mile Marker 14. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1 INCH IN 30 MINUTES
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
